content.description:
Climb the dihedral, following the series of ledges to the top.  A great beginner climb and/or first lead.  The large ledges make this route a good choice for practicing multipitch.  Be sure to bring at least 25 ft of rope if you are doing it in three pitches. 

 RCM&W #4, p. 155.
content.protection: Nuts, Hexes, Cams.  Mostly nut sized.  Hexes and nuts for the TR setup.
content.location: From the parking lot/visitor's center, this route lies about 100 yards down the road to the river boat dock on the right.   There is a gravel area with several large rock.  Sonny and Jaunita is the first dihedral on the right.

content.description: NIce beginner trad lead - good stances, adequate pro, convenient anchor set up, and some fun movement. There's a rattly block near the top
content.protection: Nuts and cams, mostly small to #.75. Gear anchor in a vertical crack
content.location: Dihedral just left of The Other One

content.description:
A great beginner route and/or trad lead.  Small (for a 5.5) holds lead to a large ledge.  Continue past the ledge on large blocks.  Many harder variations exist on the face.   

RCM&W #7, p. 156.
content.protection: Nuts, Hexes, Cams. Mostly nut sized. Hexes and nuts for the TR setup
content.location: From the parking lot/visitor's center, this route lies about 100 yards down the road to the river boat dock on the right. There is a gravel area with several large rock.  The Other One is the left most climbing.  Left of the large tree about 10 feet up (The Cornice).

content.description:
A rather short but fun climb.  The crux is getting started.  This route takes good gear for its entire short length.  I know some people try to place as many pieces as possible on it. 

 RCM&W #1, p.155.
content.protection: Nuts, cams, hexes.  For the TR setup add some webbing.
content.location: About 25 yards from the parking lot at the visitor's center on the road to the boat dock.

content.description: Start under the big fin (similar starting move as Noah's - a high right foot) and climb straight up. The crux is awkwardly negotiating the right side of the fin. You'll probably love it or hate it. If you stay left at the top there's an avoidable hole that's likely to contain a european paper wasp nest.I listed this as a 5.9 because I found it definitely harder than Daphnis and Chloe.
content.protection: Same TR setup as Noah's Ark (nuts and pods for a black and blue totem). I forgot to pay attention if there was adequate pro to lead it

content.description: Overhang-capped arete right of Daphnis & Chloe.Â
content.protection: standard rack.  long webbing to setup top rope

content.description:
Climb the face to the right of Sonny and Juanita. 

 RCM&W #3, p.155.
content.protection: Nuts, Hexes and Cams.  Mostly smaller stuff.  Hexes and Nuts for TR setup, easy to TR as variation of Sonny and Juanita.
content.location: From the parking lot/visitor's center, this route lies about 100 yards down the road to the river boat dock on the right. There is a gravel area with several large rock. This route lies to the right of Sonny and Juanita which is the first dihedral on the right.

content.description:
Climb the arete avoiding the tree as best as possible.  Pro some what thin at the top.   

RCM&W #6, p. 156.
content.protection: Nuts, Hexes, and Cams.  Mostly small stuff.  Hexes and nuts for the TR setup.
content.location: From the parking lot/visitor's center, this route lies about 100 yards down the road to the river boat dock on the right. There is a gravel area with several large rock. The cornice is the obvious arete with a large tree 10 ft up and to the left of Sonny and Juanita.

content.description:
Start on Sonny and Juanita and move left along a prominent crack about two-thirds of the way up.  Then finish on the arete (The Cornice).   

RCM&W #5, p.156.
content.protection: Nuts, Hexes, Cams. Mostly nut sized. Hexes and nuts for the TR setup.
content.location: From the parking lot/visitor's center, this route lies about 100 yards down the road to the river boat dock on the right. There is a gravel area with several large rock. Sonny and Juanita is the first dihedral on the right.

content.description: Tourist Rocks are located along the asphalt service road, on the right as you walk towards the boat loading area.  Noah's Ark is the first climbable formation. There are some bouldering/warm up traverses between Noah's Ark and Sonny and Juanita area.  Expect an audience when climbing this area.
